title: CDC Declares Sleep Deprivation a Public Health Epidemic
introText: The CDC has officially declared sleep deprivation a public health epidemic after finding that 40% of Americans are chronically sleep-deprived. The agency is launching initiatives to address the health crisis.

content.content: The CDC report found 40% of Americans get less than 6 hours of sleep nightly, far below the recommended 7-9 hours. Sleep deprivation contributes to chronic disease, accidents, and mental health issues.
Chronic sleep deprivation increases risk of obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and cognitive decline. The CDC estimates sleep-related issues cost $411 billion annually in lost productivity.
The agency is funding research, launching awareness campaigns, and working with employers to promote healthy sleep. School start times and work schedules are being reconsidered.
